Name: Jatin Kumar
Heading: Shaheed Bhagat Singh Evening College: pros and cons
Review:
I have chosen this course because I am a finance enthusiast. It provides practical knowledge for real-world challenges over and above the regular B.com programme.
But if you are getting a college with good placement history with so many companies coming for placement frequently, you should opt for B.com(p) in that college.
All faculties are doctorates. Most of the faculties have good knowledge as well as impart their knowledge in the best manner.
But some of the faculties suck the blood in all the ways, such as by not having good knowledge-sharing capabilities as well as do not cooperate with internal assessments and attendance.
There are around 3000 students, and 40 faculties with each faculty having a good knowledge to teach multiple subjects.
Exams are conducted two times a year,i.e. on time in one semester.
Exams are easy to pass, you just have a basic knowledge of the concept asked and must have good handwriting.

Many societies and clubs are there in the college  including tech, non tech, dance, music drama and everything

Name: rickdev hazra
Heading: Insider of NIT Calicut (pros and cons)
Review:
Environmental Geo technology is a combined course of Environmental Engineering and Geotechnical engineering. Mostly Geotech-based course.
In 2022 MTech. Batch there are 26 students and faculties are about 12 to 15.
Well-qualified teachers with highly experienced. Most teachers are actively publishing theses, articles, and projects. They are very helpful in terms of teaching as well as guidance. The teaching method is satisfactory. Mostly they do blackboard work and presentations. They bind this 2 years course full of projects, presentations, and seminars. The laboratory is also very good. And students can go and do their experiments any time. No issue with that. There will be p.hd students who will help in doing laboratory experiments.
Here one mid-term paper of 30 marks, assignments of 20 marks, and end semester of 50 marks are there. A cgpa-based system where getting passing marks is easy. The minimum required CGPA is 6.5. Below this cgpa MTech students will not get their stipend of 12,400 Rs.

Name: Palak chaurasia
Heading: Best of memories
Review:
Coming to my first day, it was orientation day and the event was scheduled at 900 hrs at Galgotias College(both are different). The seminar hall was one of the best I've ever seen and then we were given know how about the University rules and regulations, attendance(most important aspect in GU), examination patterns, marks breakup internals externals and we were also told about societies and clubs, events that take place every year, annual fest, scholarships etc by our then Dean Dr M. Khalid (Now Dr Parmanand Astya). Then we were welcomed by our Pro Vice-Chancellor Dr Renu Luthra. A small welcome message from her. After that, we were taken to the University campus for visit by our seniors and they told us where all required amenities will be found. The thing I liked most is ragging is completely abolished from Galgotias.

Then our classes started after two days. As the place is not that happening as compared to Delhi, I still used to miss, my parents, very much and the place where I've been from.

Name: Aman singh
College: SRM Institute of Science and Technology - [SRMIST]
Heading: Overall review of SRM University
Review:
The fee structure for SRM University varies based on the program and campus. It is advisable to check the official website of the university for the latest and most accurate information.
Regarding scholarships, SRM University offers various types of scholarships to deserving students based on merit and/or financial need. Some scholarships are based on academic performance, while others are based on a combination of academic performance and need. There is also a limited number of scholarships available for international students.
For financial assistance, SRM University has tie-ups with banks and financial institutions to provide educational loans to students who need financial assistance.
The university also provides campus jobs to its students through its placement cell, the companies that visited our campus are DXC, TCS, Infosys, Capgemini, Cognizant, Tech Mahindra, and HCL. These companies hire students in bulk with an average package of 4-5 lpa.

Heading: SIBM Pune - The college you want to be at!
Review:
First things first, the look, feel, and vibe of the campus are surreal. In a single day itself, you can witness the different seasons, from bright warm sunny mornings to heavy downpours during the evenings, to chilly winters, the hilltop has a myriad of colors waiting for you to discover.

Name: Satwik Sayan Ghosh
College: ISM Dhanbad - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITISM]
Heading: Know your College
Review: The course structure is very well planned. The micro schedule and the number of lecture hours for each topic are included in the lecture plan. Name: Rishi Raj Khanna
College: Shri Govindram Seksaria Institute of Technology and Science- [SGSITS]
Heading: Internship Opportunities at SGSITS
Review:
Every year the Institute organizes cultural events for the students in both the semesters. 

The academic session starts with a fresher’s day “Aavahan”. This program is exclusively designed for the fresh students joining the Institute. 

the Institute hosts a Techno-Cultural event “Aayaam”. This program hosts large number of events. Nearly 1500-2000 students take part in this event.

Currently college library of SGSITS is fully flagged with good quality of high cost standard reference and text - books, world reputed International and National research journals, theses, project reportsand electronic learning resources in all disciplines of technical education. 

Amenities provided in the classroom are podium benches, stage for the faculty, a. c. , fans, tubelights and tables. 

Games like Football, Cricket, Badminton, Volleyball, Throw ball, Basketball, Netball, Chess, Table Tennis are being played. 

Clubs in the college: Ojasva, Pratibimb, Kshitij, E-Cell.

Name: SHASHANK THAKUR
Heading: My Experience with IMT Ghaziabad
Review:
There is something going on at any given time on campus. There are several clubs and committees organizing various events. The annual fest is called Passion which generally happens in December. Chakrvyuh, organized by the sports committee, is an event to which the entire B-school fraternity looks forward every year. It is known as the "Olympics of B-school."  
Research & Consultancy Enterprise (RACE), the official consulting club of IMT Ghaziabad, organizes Koncentrix, which is a National level consulting symposium, comprises of multiple events. They also organize events like IMFC, Fireside Chat, etc.
Then there are clubs like Markup, Finesse, E-cell, and many more, all run by students.

Name: Mayank sharma
Heading: ALL ABOUT KIET,
Review: The priority of the college is to host the tech fest. The annual fest named EPOQUE is held after a particular interval of time. Other than this college is also involved in sports activities, and the sports fest is also organized on campus annually. The subject-related books are allotted before the beginning of the semester. And other than this the student can also allot the books from the library. There is some restriction on staying on campus other than college time. So for playing any sport or extracurricular activities, students have to take written permission from the dean's office(student welfare). There are several social clubs run on campus for football there is a club called fckiet, and for coding, there is DSC Kiet, innogics, and coding corner. For creativity there is c-cell. Our college also had a Ted-X club which was run by the students. All the clubs have their website and social media handles.

Name: Harshdeep Singh Kalra
Heading: Exceptional Institute
Review:
I chose this course because FORE is best in IB as a course providing colleges, it is one of the best institutions in the country with highly knowledgeable faculty. I have keen interest in International Business since my bachelor's and I have previously decided to pursue my masters in it. IB as a course gives you a global view and the scope is immense. 
There has been a total of 30 permanent faculty on the campus along with many visiting faculties. The Faculty-Student ratio would be 30/400. 
All the faculties are experts in their respective fields, unmatched by any other college faculties. More than eighty percent of faculties have Ph.D. and Doctorate level degrees. The teaching method and pedagogy puts us in a great corporate structure where we learn how to deal with many issues under high pressure and long hours of working. We develop ourselves into the leaders of tomorrow that have a vision for the future. We learn how to work for more than eight hours daily with nine hours of lectures.

I have been very lucky to be exposed to professors who have been a delight to study under. The professors are industry professionals from companies like HSBC, Zydus, Standard Chartered, HUL . 
Most of our professors are PhDs and those who aren't are from the Industry. 
There are 6 terms. It is not hard to pass but needs a lot of hard work. I got more than 9 GPA in the 1st term but I had to pull all-nighters. It depends on the person and what they prioritize. People who are very active in their clubs also get great jobs and can get better packages than high rankers. It all depends on how we carry ourselves and how much we wish to learn. IMT helps you grow as an Individual.

Review: IET DAVV conducts central India's biggest fest named AAKSHANK and it happens around March. You'll be able to get each book from your course from the college library and you can even avail of e-books online. The college has an inter-branch sports competition conducted by the ISC sports club in the month of December/January. The college has many other clubs like the entrepreneurship club, engineers without Borders, NCC, NSS, phoenix gaming club and many more. The campus life is pretty good if you're able to adjust yourself and find your type of people.

Name: Chaitanya Kumar
College: Anil Neerukonda Institute of Technology & Sciences - [ANITS]
Heading: Good To Join
Review:
Placement starts in the third year second semester. We get trained by outside companies to shape up for the exam but we're charged extra for placements. The highest Package is from Amazon offering 20lacs pa for the role of SDE & AWS. but the intake of students is 10 from the whole college. Many students are placed in companies like TCS having an average salary of 3.5lacs pa. Around 40% of students are placed last year. I'm planning to study abroad after graduation.
As I'm interested in programming I've chosen this course. The faculty-student ratio is 1:25. Faculty members are not at all experienced in teaching us the subjects. They don't have that knowledge or experience of the curriculum. Most of the faculty members are comfortable in only one domain and when asked to teach other subjects they're no good at all. While some of them just show all the contents through slides using PPT and get over it. There's an end-semester exam for every 5 months divided into 2 semesters.

Name: Barath kumar
College: KG Reddy College of Engineering and Technology - [KGRCET]
Heading: i had great experience till now nd i'm sure it would be great journey
Review: Excellent on-campus life sports are this school's best feature because of the diversity of its pupils, who come from many places and colleges to participate in tournaments on our campus. If you communicate with them, you might learn more about society. All cultural events are under the direction of the department in charge of student welfare(clubs like literary, came for events, cie for providing guidance in entrepreneurship and etc). There are over many CCTV cameras and security guards on duty. the library where we can get different books regarding subjects, languages, and journals.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: A Good College For Teachers Education Program With High On Placement
Review:
I was passionate about teaching mathematics at the TGT level and wanted to pursue a teacher's education program.
So, I opted for BSc.BEd Course at RIE, Bhopal. It is a central institute that comes directly under NCERT.
It has a vast diversified curriculum for all round development of students.
The faculty: student ratio is 1:5.
faculty members at RIE are good and have many years of experience in the field of education. They employ various methods like GD, Project Work, Field Trips, ICT, etc.
The difficulty level of exams is moderate as it differs from person to person. There are 2-3 days gap in between exam.

Name: Lakshay Pandey
Heading: University is Good
Review: I have very much interest in Programming so I choose this course. All the faculties are well educated as most of them are from top iit's and nit's. The teaching is good.  1 year consists of 2 semesters and 1 semester consists of two exams one is the mid-term and the second one is end-term.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Story of RIE
Review:
The fee of this college is very less if we talk only about the college fee then it is different according to the category but for obc or general this fee is 14000 rupees and if we mix the hostel fee then this is 20000 rupees.
And the mess fee will be 2000 rupees. And talking about scholarships, the MP scholarship is available for the students of Madhya Pradesh and the NCERT scholarship is available for students of other states.

Name: Sai Shankar
College: International Institute of Information Technology - [IIIT] Naya Raipur
Heading: Life at IIIT NAYA RAIPUR
Review:
The campus life is quite good, our college has almost everything that is required for Engineering students. We have one of the biggest techno-cultural fests in India named Technovate it will be held for three days. We have cultural events almost every month. We have a good library facility
which will be open till 9 pm and we even have E-Library. We have full Wi-Fi in the ed Academic block and hostels were provided with ethernet so don't forget to bring ethernet cables. We have an annual sports meet named Aarambh. We have various technical(AIML, Cipercell, Comet Tsoc, E-cell, etc) and cultural clubs(Igniters, Capriccio, Take-the-bait, etc). We have almost all the sports facilities(TT, football, Badminton, Cricket, Volleyball, Basketball, etc).

Name: Jayash kale
Heading: Internship
Review: The jnvs and kvs are given opportunities to the college students in the 7th semester and these internships are added to the curriculum of the Rie. The mini project is also there for the students. these projects were also added to the curriculum.

Name: Aman Agarwal
Heading: THE COMPLETE EXPERIENCE AT FSM
Review: I chose to do PGDM ib because I have a keen interest in international affairs moreover it gives you the opportunity to grow your career and get placed abroad the faculties are great they provide deep knowledge about the subjects and keep you busy with assignments and strict deadlines where you learn how to work under pressure a student has to complete 60 credits in the first year out of which 54 credits are from core courses and 6 from electives exams are held twice every trimester there is no gap between the exams mostly two exams are held in one day but the difficulty and marking are relatively easy.

Name: Jagmohan
Heading: Satyawati Review
Review: Annual fests are held in Feb and the Last of Jan and ncc fest is also held in March. Books and journals of the whole syllabus are available in our college library and it's good. Classes have everything in good shape and sports is good for our college with sports like basketball football cricket etc and events like dance music debate are also held. Societies are there like enactus cdf etc

Name: Mandeep
Heading: CGC Internals
Review: Parivartan is the biggest fest organized in the campus which goes for 2 days. Famous singers give performances and students enjoys. Apart from this,there is an event from different courses at every day. There is central library in ECE block-1. There are many books and journals available for every courses. There are about 15000-16000 books for specific Branches. Also, students can surf through the digital library as well. There is also an annual sports meet organized within the campus. There are many clubs run by students like Electronics Project Club, Google Developer Club,etc.

Name: Vinay Verma
College: IIT Roorkee - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITR]
Heading: IIT ROORKEE review
Review:
Annual Cultural Fest- Thomso ( conducted in October)
Annual Technical Fest- Cognizance (conducted in march)

Name: PRAMIT NATH
Heading: Wholesome Experience!

Name: Soumyansu Satabdi Das

Review:

Name: Jayshree Das
College: IIT BHU - Indian Institute of Technology
Heading: Kbow about IIT BHU
Review:
There are 3big fest are organized in our institute "Kashiyatra" is the cultural fest of IIT BHU  conducted in the month of January and "Technex" is the technical fest conducted in the month of March. Many celebrities are invited to perform and guests for think talk in both fest. There is also one Sports fest "Spardha" conducted in the month of October. 
About books and resources, we have a library which has a lot of books, journals,  magazines and also an AC study hall.
There are many clubs and councils in our institute. Students choose according to their interests and continue for years.  Council related to photography, drama, Art, Astrology, Quiz, Sports, Modeling, Music, Dance everything is there. 
Apart from this, there is a social service council that has some clubs under it. Also, our students teach some poor students and celebrate every festival with them through "Gyan Udyaan" and "Sahyog club" and also donate old books for those needy students.

Name: Aastha Arora
Heading: Good

Name: Utkarsh
Heading: Quite a good College considering overall growth potential
Review:
Fests are held during February and March and consist of cultural and tech fests. Books are provided by the college itself and included in tuition fees. Classrooms are modern with AC, Whiteboard, Smartboard, Cameras, Speakers and Plug Points to charge laptops.
A lot of stadiums and grounds are built for different sports and sports participation is thoroughly encouraged and appreciated. A lot of clubs in various technical and non-technical domains operate too.

Name: Sumit Singh Bisht
Heading: Nice Internship program.
Review:
Life at the campus is very enjoying full for anyone who came from another state because from here you can see the shape of mountains and other beautiful things. Here everyone is very social which helps everyone to meet and communicate easily with anyone we also have a Q club and their infrastructure is also very good they have provided computer labs hotel management and a moot court for practising law students there is an annual fest which was held by the quantum University and it is dharohar it is conducted in April there are big libraries you can have many generals and books which were important for your courses.
If I say about sports so I have to say that Quantum University has done very great work on sports and other extracurricular activities they have provided special fields for cricketers and a basketball court.

Name: Anirudh sharma
Heading: POV of a second semester students @amity Noida
Review:
From the beginning of the sixth-semester students become eligible for internships and in 8th semester they are eligible for jobs too. There is a tremendous opportunity of getting campus placement for techies. Many clubs like data science, cyber security, artificial intelligence etc keep bringing competition opportunities on regular basis from your first semester only.
Anyone who is interested to join a company which doesn't visit campus. Can give his name and company details to the placement cell of the university which is very active. It will definitely show them the path to getting a job in a dream company. 
There are many companies which visit the campus. A few of them are IBM, Cisco, Amazon, human ressocia, Google India, Lloyd etc. 
The highest offered package was 45lpa by human ressocia.
Nearly every student gets the opportunity to work but many of them choose to study further, join a family business etc. I don't know the percentage of students who get placed on campus.

Name: Gaurav Mandal
Heading: The Reality of GL Bajaj Institute of Technology and Management.
Review:
The fees hike policy is applicable in new admissions only they mention all 4-year fee structure at the time of admission and provide the written fees structure and the new 3-4 year department follow that fee structure for those batch for example If I am took admitted in 2021 so all 4 years I follow the fee structure but when someone took admission in 2022 there may be some difference but they also follow the same for 3-4 years.
The scholarship is only applicable to those students who took admitted from counselling and 75%+ attendance is required and some more perspective is applicable. There's a Finance department if anyone has any type of issue or query about loans, payments, fees, etc.
In my college, There are many big on-campus placements going on approx (10-60LPA) was recorded on campus placements.
but sometimes I think the fees are too high and expensive for many lower-middle-class students.
